intro: Pentas herbacea, commonly known as the dwarf pentas, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant produces clusters of small, star-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white, which bloom throughout the year in warm climates. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening. Its compact growth habit and prolonged flowering period make it an attractive addition to gardens and containers.
